pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:0.5: 28. The training rule on giving robes
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā was giving monastic robes to actors, dancers, acrobats, magicians, and musicians, saying,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.5: “Venerable Thullanandā is a learned reciter; she’s confident and skilled at giving teachings.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.6: Give to her; work for her!”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.7: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.8: “How can Venerable Thullanandā give monastic robes to householders?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.9: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā does this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.12: “How can the nun Thullanandā do this?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.14: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:1.15.1: ‘If a nun gives a monastic robe to a householder or a male wanderer or a female wanderer, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.1.8: any male wanderer apart from Buddhist monks and novice monks.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.1.10: any female wanderer apart from Buddhist nuns, trainee nuns, and novice nuns.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.1.12: a mark has been made is what is meant.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.1.13: If she gives it away, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.2.2: if she gives one to her mother or father;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.2.5: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc28:2.2.6: The eighth training rule is finished.
